title: Banana Social App ‚Äî Initial Build

requirements.text: Implement a backend data model and actor with the following entities: User (id, username, avatarEmoji, followersCount, followingCount), Post (id, authorId, content, bananaReactions, timestamp), and Follow (followerId, followeeId). Expose query and update methods: createUser, getUser, createPost, getPosts (paginated feed), reactToPost (increment banana reaction count), followUser, unfollowUser, getFollowers, getFollowing.

quotes: post banana-related content, react with banana emojis, follow other users, and browse a feed of banana posts

acceptanceCriteria: Users can be created and retrieved by ID.
Posts can be created with text content and retrieved as a paginated feed sorted by most recent.
Reacting to a post increments its banana reaction count.
Follow/unfollow operations update follower and following counts correctly.
All state is persisted in stable variables.

requirements.text: Build a global feed page that fetches and displays all posts in reverse-chronological order. Each post card must show the author's username, avatar emoji, post content, timestamp, and a banana reaction button (üçå) displaying the current reaction count. Clicking the reaction button calls reactToPost on the backend.

quotes: browse a feed of banana posts

acceptanceCriteria: Feed page loads and displays posts from the backend.
Each post card displays author info, content, timestamp, and banana reaction count.
Clicking üçå sends a reactToPost call and updates the displayed count optimistically.

requirements.text: Build a Compose Post UI ‚Äî a text area (max 280 characters) with a üçå submit button ‚Äî that calls createPost on the backend and prepends the new post to the feed on success.
acceptanceCriteria: Compose area enforces a 280-character limit with a visible character counter.
Submitting a non-empty post calls createPost and the new post appears at the top of the feed.
Submit button is disabled when the input is empty or exceeds 280 characters.

requirements.text: Build a User Profile page that displays the user's username, avatar emoji, follower count, following count, and their posts. Include Follow / Unfollow toggle button that calls followUser or unfollowUser on the backend and updates the counts in the UI.
acceptanceCriteria: Visiting a profile page shows that user's info and their posts.
Follower and following counts are displayed and update after follow/unfollow actions.
Follow button toggles between Follow and Unfollow states based on current relationship.

requirements.text: Apply a bold, playful visual theme inspired by bananas: a warm yellow and deep brown color palette, rounded card components, banana-emoji accents throughout the UI, cheerful sans-serif typography, and a sticky top navigation bar with the app logo and links to Feed and Profile. Keep the layout mobile-friendly and enforce the theme consistently across all pages.

quotes: fun social platform themed around everyone's favorite yellow fruit

acceptanceCriteria: All pages use the yellow/brown banana color palette via Tailwind theme tokens.
Navigation bar is sticky and present on all pages with Feed and Profile links.
Cards, buttons, and interactive elements use consistent rounded styling.
Layout is responsive and usable on mobile screen widths.

constraints: All backend logic must reside in a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo.
Do not edit any files listed in frontend.immutablePaths.
Use Tailwind CSS utility classes for all styling; do not introduce external CSS frameworks.
nonGoals: User authentication via Internet Identity (can be added later).
Image or video uploads in posts.
Push notifications or real-time updates via WebSockets.

required: Cartoon banana bunch logo with a cheerful face on a transparent background (banana-logo.dim_256x256.png)
Warm yellow textured banner background with scattered hand-drawn banana illustrations (feed-banner.dim_1200x300.png)
